title: Defense Counterintelligence and Human Intelligence Center
text:
The Defense Counterintelligence and Human Intelligence Center (DCHC) is a component of the <a href="United%20States">United States</a> <a href="Defense%20Intelligence%20Agency">Defense Intelligence Agency</a>. It is mandated to manage, develop and execute <a href="U.S.%20Department%20of%20Defense">U.S. Department of Defense</a> <a href="counterintelligence">counterintelligence</a> and <a href="human%20intelligence%20%28espionage%29">human intelligence</a> activities worldwide; it's also responsible for oversight for training, doctrine, policy, <a href="Information%20Technology%20Architecture">information technology architecture</a>, planning and <a href="career%20management">career management</a>.
The DCHC absorbed many functions and authorities of the <a href="Counterintelligence%20Field%20Activity">Counterintelligence Field Activity</a> and the <a href="Strategic%20Support%20Branch">Strategic Support Branch</a>, which were disestablished simultaneously with the DCHC's establishment. Despite the counterintelligence component of its work, the center has no <a href="law%20enforcement">law enforcement</a> authority.
In 2012, Defense Secretary <a href="Leon%20Panetta">Leon Panetta</a> and Director of National Intelligence <a href="James%20Clapper">James Clapper</a> announced the creation of the <a href="Defense%20Clandestine%20Service">Defense Clandestine Service</a>. This has been seen as an upgrading and rebranding of DIA's current HUMINT capabilities.
